moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Advanced Theory and Practices/10 Advanced Engagement Metrics/Traffic Sources

overview.quote: It's not just about how many people watch, but how they found you in the first place.
overview.introText: Traffic sources reveal the journey viewers took to reach your content. Whether through the algorithm, your profile, or external links, each path tells a different story about your content's appeal and can guide your strategy.

keyTerms.definition: The primary discovery mechanism where platforms recommend content to viewers (For You Page, Browse, Explore, etc.).
Views from people who visited your profile page and specifically chose your video from your collection.
Views originating outside the platform, like from shared links, embedded videos, or other websites.
When platforms limit a video's distribution in the algorithmic feed, often due to content concerns or low engagement.

actionPlan: Create content series to drive profile visits
Monitor unusual spikes in external traffic
Prompt viewers to check your profile
Adjust strategy if feed traffic is low

mainContent.title: The Feed is King
mainContent.text: Aim for 95%+ of traffic from the algorithmic feed - this means the platform actively promotes your content. Low feed traffic may indicate throttling, content issues, or that the algorithm isn't confident in your video's appeal.

mainContent.title: The Profile Visit Value
mainContent.text: High profile traffic means viewers like your content enough to explore more. This indicates strong audience connection and potential for building a dedicated following rather than just viral one-offs.

mainContent.title: External Traffic Insights
mainContent.text: Sudden spikes in external traffic mean your content is being shared or discussed elsewhere. This could indicate going viral on other platforms, being featured in articles, or targeted bot activity.

mainContent.title: The Follower-Only Trap
mainContent.text: If most traffic comes from followers rather than the feed, you're in a growth plateau. Your content may feel insider-focused or rely on previous knowledge, making it less accessible to new viewers.

proTips.text: External traffic from friends won't trick the algorithm - engagement needs to come organically from the feed to count.
If using friends to jumpstart comments, have them ask provocative questions rather than posting generic praise.

finalWords.emphasis: How they find you shapes how they engage
finalWords.description: Each traffic source requires different optimization strategies.
